content.mainTitle: Sub-100ms Redirects, Anywhere in the World
content.subTitle: Redirect latency is not just a technical metric — a slow redirect loses conversions, frustrates users, and signals poor performance to search engines.
features: **Edge network:** Requests are served from the nearest edge location — cutting round-trip time to a minimum for users everywhere.
**Redirect to the fastest target:** When a redirect has multiple destinations, traffic is automatically routed to the fastest-responding one.
**Instant propagation:** Changes you make in the dashboard reach every edge location in seconds — not hours.

content.mainTitle: Scales to Any Volume Without Configuration
content.subTitle: Whether you're parking ten domains or handling millions of hits a day, the infrastructure adjusts automatically — no capacity planning, no manual intervention.
features: **Auto-scaling:** Traffic spikes are absorbed automatically — performance stays consistent whether you're sending ten hits or ten million.
**99.99% uptime:** Redundant infrastructure across regions keeps your redirects online — even during regional outages.
**Automatic failover:** If a node becomes unavailable, traffic is rerouted instantly with no downtime for your users.

content.subTitle: International domains, non-Latin scripts, multilingual portfolios — all handled correctly with no encoding issues or special configuration.

**Wildcard SSL at scale:** Auto-provisioned HTTPS for every domain in your portfolio, renewed automatically with zero manual steps.
**Thousands of domains, one account:** Manage domain portfolios of any size from a single dashboard — consistent performance across all of them.

content.subTitle: DDoS protection and continuous monitoring mean your redirects stay online under attack, during traffic surges, and at any hour.
features: **DDoS protection:** Advanced protection keeps redirects online under distributed attack conditions — no manual response required.
**Infrastructure monitoring:** Continuous checks across the global network with instant response to any performance issue.
**Consistent SLA:** 99.99% uptime across our global network — the reliability level that enterprise and high-volume operations require.

faqs.question: How does redirect latency affect SEO and conversions?
faqs.answer: Redirect latency adds to a page's total load time — even a few hundred milliseconds increases bounce rates and signals slower performance to search engines. Google's Core Web Vitals measure load speed, and a slow redirect hop contributes negatively. Edge-based redirects resolve in sub-100ms because the request is handled by the nearest server to the user, rather than routing back to a central origin.

faqs.question: What is an edge network and why does it matter for redirects?
faqs.answer: An edge network is a system of distributed servers positioned close to users around the world. Instead of every redirect request travelling to a central server, it is handled by the nearest edge node — dramatically reducing latency. For redirects, this means users anywhere in the world experience near-instant forwarding rather than waiting for a round trip to a distant server.

faqs.question: Can a redirect service handle millions of requests per day?
faqs.answer: Yes. RedirHub's infrastructure auto-scales to absorb traffic spikes automatically — there is no manual capacity planning required. The edge network distributes load across global nodes, so high-traffic events such as campaign launches or viral traffic spikes do not degrade redirect performance.

faqs.question: What uptime does a redirect service guarantee?
faqs.answer: RedirHub maintains 99.99% uptime across its global edge network, backed by redundant infrastructure and automatic failover between nodes. If a node becomes unavailable, traffic is rerouted instantly — users experience no downtime.

faqs.question: How do I redirect domains for users in different countries?
faqs.answer: Redirect rules in RedirHub apply globally — all users, regardless of location, are forwarded by the nearest edge node. For international domain portfolios, wildcard domain redirects can point an entire domain or subdomain to a destination in one rule. IDN (International Domain Name) support ensures non-Latin domain names are handled correctly without encoding issues.
